data.title: Solid architecture from the past in the heart of the downtown area.
data.text: Parking is metered and somewhat limited.  The building entrances are guarded and you will pass through a metal detector.  In and of itself, it is a magnificent building.

data.title: Tallest City Hall
data.text: Come and walk the 30 or so floors.  Great lunch event.  The is the heart of Kansas City, MO.  If you are downtown stop in to see the wonderful architecture.

data.title: Call ahead
data.text:
Call ahead if you want to do the observation deck. They will close it based on temperature and arbitrary wind speed. The determining factor is if the weather can "blow someone away." Not kidding.

Don't come with teasers or fingernail clippers. They'll throw them away or break them "for free" when you go through the first security check.

data.title: View of the city and surrounding area.
data.text: Most Kansas Citians don't know that you can visit City Hall and go almost to the top floor that has an observtion deck from which you can see all of KC and parts of the surrounding communities. Used to be a walk in trip but now you need an escort provided by the city to go up on the deck. Best to call ahead to see if weather will permit. It is closed if it's too windy, for example. FREE!

data.title: Best view over the city!
data.text:
You enter via the main entrance and ask for the observation deck at the security check point. They will tell you that you have to take the elevator to the lower level (LL). Their your ID or passport needs to be scanned. Afterwards you are allowed to take the elevator to the 28 level where a security guide will wait on you. From their you have to walk two more floors up and then you get a private tour with the best view over the city.  Best thing: It is for free and you will be probably be by yourself up their. 

We had with Talbot a very good your guide and learned a lot about the City. Even got excellent restaurant recommendations. Thank you!

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Nobody ever knows that you can go to the top of this building. Amazing views you don't get a lot of time up there but it's a fun cheap thing to do and you can see how much of Kansas City has changed a lot of the parks look really great from up above

data.title: Observation Deck visit
data.text:
Stopped by here on a steamy, 100 degree June day.  I am terrified of heights, but my husband had been wanting to see the building and the deck, so I sucked it up and went for it.  It was really pretty fun, but definitely will make your palms sweaty if you don't do well with heights.  The observation deck is not enclosed (there is a wall around it that goes about up to my chest, but it's otherwise open to the elements), so you're getting the wind and the birds and the heat (or rain if you go on those days!).  

They don't let you go up alone, a security guard goes with you.  We had a nice young man who I believed was named Dunston (?).  He was very friendly, and told us about how surreal it is going out there on cloudy days, when you can hear all the noises below, but can't see anything through the fog (you're 30 stories up).  The guards we encountered were all very nice, but their first concern is security, so keep that in mind.  You will go through a metal detector, so just don't bring much in with you.  Go in the side of the building with the Lincoln statue, get through security, then take one of the elevators down to the lower level.  They'll copy your ID and take you up to the 28th floor.  It's a super fast elevator!  After that, there are 2 floors of stairs, and a walk through a machinery room.  GREAT photo opportunities from up there, and I could see the spiral of the temple in Independence from that far up!  

Parking is typical for downtown. The JE Dunn Construction garage was the easiest, we paid $3.00.  You get 15-20 minutes for the view, and tours stop at 3, so be sure to get there early.

data.title: Get a 360 degree view of the city.
data.text: Once going through security proceed to the basement floor; then take an elevator ride to the top observation deck.  An amazing view of the city, and surrounding area.

data.title: Best View
data.text: My sister and I visited the observatory on a Friday. We were looking for something fun and unique to do. We were escorted to the top by a very nice employee. She even took our picture for us! I would recommend this to anyone! The 360 view was amazing. It was a bit windy up top so I would not recommend wearing a hat. It was a great to experience it with my sister and I would definitely return.

data.title: Don't miss!
data.text: In addition to the beautiful decor of the building, the view from the observation deck on the 30th floor is not to be missed.  You are outside walking around the entire perimeter.  Great views of the city.  You will need identification and just let them know what you are there to see when you go through security as you enter the building.  You are escorted by security to the observation deck.  The elevator takes you to the 28th floor and you have to walk up 2 floors.  It is a wonderful activity, but not for those scared of heights.

data.title: Awesome observatory
data.text: KC City Hall has an amazing 30th floor outdoor observatory where you can get fabulous views of downtown KC.  It's only available certain hours of the day, so best to call and find out when it's available.  They have to escort you up there.  Just one thing to take note of - once you get to the top floor, you do have to climb some steep steps to get to the observatory.  But it's well worth it!

data.title: 360 degree view of Kansas City absolutely free
data.text:
The Kansas City Hall roof top is open to the public from Mondays to Fridays, 9AM to 3PM. All you need to have is a valid ID on you (Apparently, they use this as a precaution to identify all visitors to identify people just in case somebody would decide to jump over). 

They take you down to the lower levels where you present your ID and be accompanied by the security officer who will take you up the 28th floor. Then you will climb 4-5 flights of stairs to finally get to the rooftop. It is a bit of an exercise if you're not fit enough.

You get to spend 20 minutes maximum walking around the roof top and checking out the 360 view of Kansas City. For FREE.

data.title: Questionable Maintenance.
data.text: I work in downtown Kansas City and I went to City Hall on my lunch break because I heard about the Observation Deck and thought that would be a good spot to take a few photos of the city from. After getting to the 28th floor there was a sign that said you actually have to go to the lower level security to  be let up to the observation deck, "I thought, this would've been great to know before hand but oh well my mistake." I get to the lower security desk to ask about getting to view the Observation Deck only to be told maintenance is going on and to try back on Monday as it should be finished then. I call on that following Friday there' maintenance still going which is odd because I go by the building during day time hours and there is no sign of any work being done. I call 3 more Fridays and still maintenance which is very odd and I get the feeling the security guard lady is just being plain lazy which is very disconcerting when you consider my tax dollars are paying for her to be lazy and not do her job. I am now resorting to writing the poor reviews and trying to find outlets for letting them know my disgust.

data.title: Great view and friendly staff
data.text: When you pass through the metal detectors at the entrances, mention you want to see the observation deck.  The staff will directed to the basement area.  You have to let them see your ID and someone will take up in the elevator to the top.  It's the second best view (Liberty Memorial's tower is still #1) of the city and it's FREE!

data.title: long wait for good view
data.text:
My hotel looked up City Hall's website and told me I could get in at 0800.  I went along at around 0830 and had to wait until 0915 before someone was free to take me up to the Observation Deck.  This would not be available for wheelchair users or those  who are infirm, as the elevator only goes up so far and then there are several flights of stairs to be negotiated.  The view all around the top deck is very good, as you can see for miles, but if you don't like heights, be aware that it is open with no protective glass.  The building itself is classical art deco, very attractive, and the statue of Lincoln and his boy delightful.

Security here is tight and pretty unsmiling.  In all the other City Halls/Capitol Buildings I have visited across the States, once through initial bag check, you are free to wander everywhere - but not here.

data.title: Beautiful building and free view from the observation deck
data.text: City Hall is a beautiful building, but throw in a free ride to the top observation deck and this is an attraction that should not be missed.  You will have to go through metal detectors upon entering city hall.  They will direct you to the basement area where you have to produce a driver's license before you go up to the observation deck.   The viewing area wraps around the building for a 360 degree view of the city of Kansas City.  Also, there is a nice statue of Lincoln on one side of the building and one of Andrew Jackson across the street in front of the county courthouse.  Dont miss this.

data.title: observation deck not to be missed
data.text: 360 degree view quite spectacular and then tour the plaza and the courthouse

data.title: Observation Deck
data.text: If you take the elevator up to the outside deck near the top of the building, you get an amazing view of the city!

data.title: NO free parking after 30 mins
data.text: It is downtown so you know parking will be hard to find .... across the street to the west is public parking and the first 30 min is free but seriously who walks 5 mins to get to the building and stays 20 mins and then run back to your car or it will be 3 dollars ... it doesnt sound like much but you really dont have a choice they should stamp the parking ticket inside and make it free for those of us who only go to city hall for offical city buisness

data.title: Great View from the Top!
data.text:
My family and I went to the City Hall Observation Deck on a very hot Tuesday afternoon.  After entering and going through the first set of security, you are then directed to go to the basement and another set of security.  You then sit and wait for a tour guide to take you up to the observation deck.  

You are then taken up in an elevator to the 28th Floor, where you get out and have to walk up two floors as the Mayor does not want anyone stopping on his floor.  Once you reach the top, you are greeted with magnificent views of Kansas City.  The afternoon was quite hot (108 degrees), but despite the heat, we still managed to take advantage of the photo opportunity.  

The observation deck is open M-F from 7-3p.
